Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Toupee \Tou*pee"\ (?; 277), Toupet \Tou*pet"\ (?; 277), n. [F. toupet, dim. of OF. top a tuft; of Teutonic origin, and akin to E. top. See {Top} apex, and cf. {Topet}.] [1913 Webster] 1. A little tuft; a curl or artificial lock of hair. [1913 Webster]
2. A small wig, or a toppiece of a wig. [1913 Webster]
Her powdered hair is turned backward over a toupee. --G. Eliot. [1913 Webster]
toupee n : a small hairpiece to cover partial baldness [syn: {toupe}]
